thread.title: Man City star Aguero is OK with competition, says Zabaleta | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Man City star Aguero is OK with competition, says Zabaleta | Daily Mail Online

author: Chris Wheeler For Mailonline
title: Man City star Aguero is OK with competition, says Zabaleta | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Pablo Zabaleta believes Sergio Aguero will cope with the new competition from Gabriel Jesus, pointing out that his Manchester City team-mate has handled similar challenges in the past. Zabaleta and Aguero are international team-mates with Argentina and have been together at City since the striker arrived in 2011. Aguero's future at the Etihad has been thrown into doubt after the 28-year-old responded to being benched for the last two games by saying that he will wait until the end of the season to see if he is still wanted by manager Pep Guardiola. Pablo Zabaleta has backed Manchester City team-mate Sergio Aguero after he was dropped The impact of Gabriel Jesus, who has scored three goals in his first two full games following a Â£27million move from Palmeiras, has only served to weaken Aguero's position. 'He'll be OK,' said Zabaleta. 'He's a mature guy. Listen, years ago it was (Carlos) Tevez, (Mario) Balotelli, (Edin) Dzeko, Kun (Aguero). 'It's not the first time he's been dropped. We need a strong squad to win titles. RELATED ARTICLES
